info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Allen, Wabash, Grant, Whitley, Blackford, Huntington, southeastern Kosciusko, Wells and southeastern Miami Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near South Whitley to near La Fontaine to 7 miles north of Elwood. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Wayne, Marion, Huntington, Wabash, Bluffton, Columbia City, Hartford City, North Manchester, Gas City, Upland, Ossian, Fairmount, Montpelier, Jonesboro, South Whitley, Sweetser, Andrews, Markle, Swayzee and La Fontaine. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 11, and near mile marker 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 315. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
